thread.title: Timing of raids not right, says Shanta Kumar
thread.title_full: Timing of raids not right, says Shanta Kumar

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Timing of raids not right, says Shanta Kumar
text:
Ravinder Sood
Palampur, September 30
Shanta Kumar, senior BJP leader and MP from Kangra, said he had never opposed the raids conducted at the residence of Chief Minister Virbhadra Singh last week, but objected to its timing as on the same day the marriage of the CMâ€™s daughter was being solemnised in Shimla. Shanta said since the CBI had registered a case against the Chief Minister for disproportionate assets and raided his houses, the Chief Minister should quit the office on moral grounds. He had no moral right to continue in the office. Talking to The Tribune on the phone from New Delhi this evening, Shanta Kumar said Virbhadra was a veteran Congress leader. He should leave the office paving way for the CBI for independent investigation into the cases pending against him.
